description:
Keys to the Keyboard series is not only informative, but fun and fairly easy to understand and accomplish! This series is meant to cover the very basics of chord-comping. In everyday understandable terms, these are the very basic chords seen in lead sheets and fake books that are above a melody line. There are timelines for different types of learners and programs to complete in 6, 9, 12 or 24 months. Whether you are a college music major, a home-schooler, a teacher wanting to supplement students with chord-learning or one who used to play and wants to play again, this program is perfect for you! The videos include close-ups of hands and even pedal work. Videos are:

Major 5-Note Scales: with whole/half steps, major chords up and down the keyboard/piano, sustain pedal.

3-Note Chords: major, minor, diminished, augmented chords, symbols for each, 5-note scales to accompany each, sharps and flats.

4-Note Chords: sevenths, dominant, major, minor, diminished, half-diminished, symbols for each.

Inversions: major, minor, dominant 7th, pedal motion (up-down), circle of 5ths (and 4ths)

Cadences: Major I-IV-V7, minor i-iv-V7, pedal.

Songs in multiple keys: Definitions, including secondary dominant, #iv diminished chords; Alphabet Song- using I-IV-V7 chords-Keys: F,C,G,D,Bb; Alouette- using ii-V7-I chords-Keys: F,C,G,D,Bb; Nearer My God to Thee- using I-IV-V7-ii7-iv-#iv diminished chords-Keys: G,D,E,Bb,C; Over the River and Through the Woods- using I-IV-V7-II7-#iv diminished chords-Keys: C,D,Bb,E + additional accompaniment pattern

Study Guide: 81 pages (downloadable) includes accompanying music charts with fingering, note names and chords/chord symbols. Also practice guides for different timelines. There's even a certificate of achievement at the end!
title: Learn Piano Online-Keys to the Keyboard
